channel.title: CVE Feed for Cesanta -- Mongoose
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Cesanta -- Mongoose

item.title: CVE-2017-2891|2024-09-16T22:52:04.709Z -- cesanta -- mongoose
item.description: An exploitable use-after-free vulnerability exists in the HTTP server implementation of Cesanta Mongoose 6.8. An ordinary HTTP POST request with a CGI target can cause a reuse of previously freed pointer potentially resulting in remote code execution. An attacker needs to send this HTTP request over the network to trigger this vulnerability.

item.title: CVE-2017-2922|2024-09-16T18:59:36.372Z -- cesanta -- mongoose
item.description: An exploitable memory corruption vulnerability exists in the Websocket protocol implementation of Cesanta Mongoose 6.8. A specially crafted websocket packet can cause a buffer to be allocated while leaving stale pointers which leads to a use-after-free vulnerability which can be exploited to achieve remote code execution. An attacker needs to send a specially crafted websocket packet over the network to trigger this vulnerability.

item.title: CVE-2017-2921|2024-09-16T22:56:25.193Z -- cesanta -- mongoose
item.description: An exploitable memory corruption vulnerability exists in the Websocket protocol implementation of Cesanta Mongoose 6.8. A specially crafted websocket packet can cause an integer overflow, leading to a heap buffer overflow and resulting in denial of service and potential remote code execution. An attacker needs to send a specially crafted websocket packet over network to trigger this vulnerability.
